intro: Campylocentrum schlechterianum, commonly known as the Schlechter's starfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
